Posts.Content: terrie45 wrote: hi all this is my first time here. i have been reading all and am feeling worse than before or more scared. i had a mammogram on sept. 12th and they found a nodule so i had another one on sept. 29. after radiologist read it he wanted an US right then so i did. today i got a letter to contact my doctor b/c it was abnormal as well. i called my doctor's office and they told me he wanted to talk to me to be at his office on oct. 8. i am very scared b/c my aunt died of BC many years ago and my mom has had biopsies in the past. i just dont know how to feel i am 45 yrs old and very concerned. i think waiting until next week to talk to me is too far away. any advice. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: abnormal/nodule mammo/US terrie45 terrie45

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2008 10:00AM terrie45 wrote: hi Terry thanks for replying, i would love to talk to you. i dont know how to message you. my daughter also has asymetrical breasts, thats what we are assuming she has no insurance to get any further testing done. my gyn saw her on an office visit for free once but thats all we can get. i am sorry that you are going through this too. i have had surgeries before to remove cysts. i am here for you as well. my email address is tsteppkermit@yahoo.com.  thanks for the prayers and i will also pray for you. terrie:)

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2008 09:27PM terrie45 wrote: thanks to all of you for replying. i am so very scared, i have a little grandson who needs me to take care of him and he's only 5, so i am very concerned for him as well, he would be devistated too. i feel numb right now and having anxiety. sorry if i sounded like all of these stories worry me more they really do help too. i will keep everyone posted and i love this site and will be here all the time. keep me in your prayers and i will do the same.
Posts.Title: abnormal/nodule mammo/US terrie45 terrie45

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2008 11:18AM terrie45 wrote: traci i am sooo sorry you are having to go through this also, i know the feeling. my aunt died of breast cancer many years ago and my mom has had scares as well.  but they have better technology now so i am hoping for the best. my grandson is only 5 and he has only me to take care of him, my mom could possibly help me but she is old and it would be hard on both of them as well. it is a very scary thing but we will get through this with god's help and the help of these wonderful women on this site. my daughter is only 23 and she is at a higher risk than me, her grandmother just died of b/c, and she is having alot of problems with no insurance to get the care she needs. this is causing me to have so much anxiety for me as well as her. my mother is 83 yrs old and refusing any more testing. so i am a train wreck. i have had a headache for 2 days now because of the stress but praying for everyone. email me anytime i will be there for you too. terrie:)
Posts.Title: abnormal/nodule mammo/US terrie45 terrie45

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2008 11:57AM terrie45 wrote: i had my doctor visit today for consultation. here is what the papers say. screening mammogram: parenchyma remains heterogeneously dense. there is a 1.5 cm area of increasing asymmetric density in the inferior left breast on the MLO view warranting further evaluation with spot compression imaging and if necessary ultrasound. there is no spiculation or suspicious microcalcification. Diagnostic Mammogram: spot compression of the breast shows a persistant area of density nearly 1 cm in size in the inferior left breast. the patient was referred for sonography. Ultrasound: a 5 mm density a the 8 oclock position was identified with solid characteristic and posterior acoustical shadowing along with a poorly defined posterior wall. some tiny cysts wer detected as well. suspicious nodule at 8 oclock left breast. Biopsy is recommended BIRADS4 suspicious abnormality- biopsy should be considered. the doctor recommended a surgical biopsy and not a needle. they will call me today with the appointment with the breast surgeon. can anyone explain to me what all this means in english. thanks a bunch ladies with all the support terrie45
Posts.Title: abnormal/nodule mammo/US terrie45 terrie45

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2008 07:10AM terrie45 wrote: hi tooz i had mine yesterday, i am hopeful.. the surgeon who did mine says it is very small and nothing to worry about even if it is malignant, nowadays they can do alot more with it and it is more easy to get rid of so that give me some hope. she told me not to worry much. so hopefully your will be a great report B9 for us both. hugs terrie
